glsa.title: NVIDIA Drivers: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities in NVIDIA drivers may allow a local attacker to gain escalated privileges.

background.p: The NVIDIA drivers provide X11 and GLX support for NVIDIA graphic boards.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in NVIDIA drivers:

ul.li: A vulnerability has been found in the way NVIDIA drivers handle read/write access to GPU device nodes, allowing access to arbitrary system memory locations (CVE-2012-4225).
A buffer overflow error has been discovered in NVIDIA drivers (CVE-2013-0131).

description.p: NOTE: Exposure to CVE-2012-4225 is reduced in Gentoo due to 660 permissions being used on the GPU device nodes by default.

impact.p: A local attacker could gain escalated privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All NVIDIA driver users should upgrade to the latest version:
